intro: Neisosperma mianum, commonly known as the Chinese gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It is often cultivated for its fruit, which is rich in vitamin C and has a tangy flavor. Neisosperma mianum is also valued for its ornamental qualities and medicinal properties.
